intro: Centaurea debdouensis, commonly known as the Debdeou Centaury, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Algeria. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features spiny stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves, typical of many Centaurea species. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. This species is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in high-altitude environments.
